00002 // http://www.cl.cam.ac.uk/research/srg/bluebook/21/crc/node6.html
00003 
00004 #include "crc.h"
00005 
00006 #define LITTLE_ENDIAN 1
00007 #define QUOTIENT 0x04C11DB7
00008 
00009 unsigned int crctab[256];
00010 
00011 void crc32_init(void)
00012 {
00013     int i,j;
00014  
00015     unsigned int crc;
00016  
00017     for (i = 0; i < 256; i++)
00018     {
00019         crc = i << 24;
00020         for (j = 0; j < 8; j++)
00021         {
00022             if (crc & 0x80000000)
00023                 crc = (crc << 1) ^ QUOTIENT;
00024             else
00025                 crc = crc << 1;
00026         }
00027         crctab[i] = crc; // may need to account for big endian
00028     }
00029 }
00030 
00031 unsigned int getcrc32(unsigned char *data, int len)
00032 {
00033     unsigned int        result;
00034     unsigned int        *p = (unsigned int *)data;
00035     unsigned int        *e = (unsigned int *)(data + len);
00036  
00037  //    if (len < 4) abort();
00038  
00039     result = ~*p++;
00040     while( p<e )
00041     {
00042 #if defined(LITTLE_ENDIAN)
00043         result = crctab[result & 0xff] ^ result >> 8;
00044         result = crctab[result & 0xff] ^ result >> 8;
00045         result = crctab[result & 0xff] ^ result >> 8;
00046         result = crctab[result & 0xff] ^ result >> 8;
00047         result ^= *p++;
00048 #else
00049         result = crctab[result >> 24] ^ result << 8;
00050         result = crctab[result >> 24] ^ result << 8;
00051         result = crctab[result >> 24] ^ result << 8;
00052         result = crctab[result >> 24] ^ result << 8;
00053         result ^= *p++;
00054 #endif
00055     }
00056  
00057     return ~result;
00058 }
